name: Lucius

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: {KAI-zar}Caesar awaits. You can speak with me later.

topics.topic_text: I've noticed that you don't carry a gun.
topics.response_text: It's a tradition in the{pray-TORR-ians}Praetorians to specialize in unarmed combat because weapons can break or jam when needed most.

topics.topic_text: I had some general questions for you.
topics.response_text: I'll answer if I can.

topics.topic_text: I don't have any more questions. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Very well.

topics.topic_text: How did you end up joining the Legion?
topics.response_text: When I was a boy, the Legion conquered my tribe. I was chosen for training as a Legionary.

topics.topic_text: What happened to the rest of your tribe?
topics.response_text: The girls and women were enslaved, and many of the men and boys were also chosen to become Legionaries. The rest were killed.

topics.topic_text: You don't hate the Legion for what it did to your tribe?
topics.response_text: We were savages. The Legion raised us up, made us better than what we were.{Slight contempt - he's a little ashamed of how backwards his tribe was.}

topics.topic_text: I have questions about something else.
topics.response_text: What did you want to talk about?

topics.topic_text: What do you think about the NCR?
topics.response_text: The NCR Rangers are the biggest threat. Without them, the NCR is nothing.

topics.topic_text: How did the NCR defeat the Legion at Hoover Dam before?
topics.response_text: We had the numbers, but not the tactics. I know - I was there at Boulder City when we were defeated.

topics.topic_text: Is there anything that you need me to do?
topics.response_text: We recently obtained an artillery weapon, but we don't have the part or the skill to fix it.

topics.topic_text: Your howitzer is operational.
topics.response_text: Well done. It will be very useful in the coming battle against the snipers the NCR will no doubt have hidden in the hills near the Dam.

topics.topic_text: I'll see what I can do.
topics.response_text: The tribe calling themselves the Boomers is obsessed with such weapons, I've been told. You can probably find a spare firing mechanism there.

topics.topic_text: Where did you get the gun, anyway?
topics.response_text: The trader, Dale Barton, salvaged it from a military base in Arizona. Yuma, I believe.

topics.topic_text: What do you need artillery for?
topics.response_text: The best marksman of the NCR are usually at the rear of any battle. The gun will allow us to strike at them.

topics.topic_text: I've noticed Legionaries prefer using machetes as weapons.
topics.response_text: {KAI-zar}Caesar has taught us that over-reliance on firearms can only weaken us in the long run. It's why we train heavily with our blades and our fists.

topics.topic_text: There are a lot of tents here.
topics.response_text: And just about every one of them is occupied. Not all at the same time, usually - groups of Legionaries come and go all the time.

topics.topic_text: If Caesar dies, who takes over the Legion?
topics.response_text: Legate Lanius will take Caesar's place at the head of the Legion. The Legate is a fine warrior, and the Legion will do well under his command.

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: {WAH-lay}Vale.

topics.topic_text: Are you the Legion's second-in-command?
topics.response_text: {Caesar alive}No, Legate Lanius is Caesar's second. The Legate replaced the Burned Man after the Legion's defeat at the Dam several years ago.

topics.topic_text: I don't have the time right now.
topics.response_text: I understand.

topics.topic_text: Can you teach me the Praetorian unarmed technique?
topics.response_text: {Bad rep with Legion}You have a poor reputation in the Legion. It wouldn't be acceptable for me to teach you anything right now.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Burned Man.
topics.response_text: The Burned Man was{KAI-zar's}Caesar's advisor and general when the Legion was originally formed. The Burned Man led us to a disastrous defeat at the Dam.

topics.topic_text: Is there anything you can tell me about the Legate?
topics.response_text: He's the best warrior in the Legion. A full Legionary by the time he was 12, he's never lost a battle.

topics.topic_text: Apology accepted.
topics.response_text: {KAI-zar's}Caesar's death is regrettable, but we can't let it stand in the way of the Legion's goals.

topics.topic_text: President Kimball is dead.
topics.response_text: {triumphant}The loss of morale in the NCR must have been staggering when their leader fell. It's proof that no one is out of the Legion's reach.

topics.topic_text: President Kimball survived the assassination attempt.
topics.response_text: Killing Kimball would've struck fear into the NCR. It's unfortunate that you weren't able to take advantage of this opportunity.

topics.topic_text: Caesar would be dead if I didn't try to help him. How dare you blame me for trying to save his life!
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] What you say is true. I apologize for my rash action - it was out of grief and loyalty. I hope you understand.

topics.topic_text: The cranial bleeding was too much for a man of his age. A younger man would have lived.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I apologize for my rash action. I understand fighting and killing, not healing. I acted out of grief and loyalty.

topics.topic_text: Let's finish this, then.
topics.response_text: Avenge{KAI-zar}Caesar!

topics.topic_text: <Lie> I did all I could to save him.
topics.response_text: Yet you failed, and you must pay.

topics.topic_text: I did all I could to save him.
topics.response_text: Yet you failed, and you must pay.

topics.topic_text: {Liked+}After everything I've done for the Legion, this one failure condemns me?
topics.response_text: {hesitant, knowing player is right}No... I suppose not. You've proved that you're a friend to us many times. I apologize for my temper.

topics.topic_text: What? You think this is my fault?
topics.response_text: His head exploded, idiot. Of course it's your fault.{to his men}Avenge{KAI-zar}Caesar!

topics.topic_text: Let's move on, then.
topics.response_text: Yes, we can't let{KAI-zar's}Caesar's death get in the way of the Legion's goals.

topics.topic_text: You need me more than I need you - don't forget that.
topics.response_text: {cooly responding to the player's threat}We'll see about that. In any case, we can't let{KAI-zar's}Caesar's death get in the way of the Legion's goals.

topics.topic_text: I've brought a doctor, Arcade Gannon, who can take care of Caesar. He's outside.
topics.response_text: Very well. I'll have him seized and brought to{KAI-zar}Caesar as his personal physician.

topics.topic_text: He's all yours.
topics.response_text: It will be done.

topics.topic_text: On second thought, hold off.
topics.response_text: {annoyed with player}{KAI-zar}Caesar's health worsens, and your indecision is unhelpful.

topics.topic_text: I'll keep that in mind.
topics.response_text: See that you do.

topics.topic_text: Out of my way, Lucius.
topics.response_text: {dismissing}Go.

topics.topic_text: No trick, and I'm only trying to help.
topics.response_text: We'll see.

topics.topic_text: President Kimball survived. His visit to the Hoover Dam was cancelled.
topics.response_text: Killing Kimball would've struck fear into the NCR. It's unfortunate that you weren't able to take advantage of this opportunity.

topics.topic_text: I've brought something to fix the Auto-Doc.
topics.response_text: Fix it, then. You're not leaving until it's done and{KAI-zar}Caesar lives.

topics.topic_text: I have what's needed to do the surgery.
topics.response_text: Do it, then. You're not leaving until it's done and{KAI-zar}Caesar lives.

topics.topic_text: A man who can cure Caesar, Arcade Gannon, waits outside. He's all yours.
topics.response_text: Good. I'll have my men seize him immediately.

topics.topic_text: No, I haven't.
topics.response_text: Then you die.

topics.topic_text: I'm still working on that, actually.
topics.response_text: You had your chance. Now you die.

topics.topic_text: About Hoover Dam...
topics.response_text: We are preparing to move against the Dam, and Legate Lanius has a part for you to play in the battle. Report to him at his camp.

description:
Lucius is a 48 year-old Caucasian Male.

A hardened veteran and one of Caesar's most trusted lieutenants, Lucius serves as the unwavering commander of the Praetorian Guard. His weathered face bears the scars of countless battles, and his eyes hold the cold, calculating gaze of a man who has seen too much of the wasteland's brutality. Despite his age, Lucius maintains his position through a combination of tactical brilliance and the profound respect he commands from his subordinates.

Lucius's Personality: Disciplined, ruthless, and fiercely loyal to Caesar's vision. Lucius is a pragmatic leader who believes in the harsh realities of the wasteland and the necessity of Caesar's methods. He is methodical in his approach to both combat and interrogation, showing no mercy to those who defy the Legion. Beneath his hardened exterior lies a strategic mind capable of anticipating his enemies' moves.

Lucius's Backstory: Born in the ruins of post-war Arizona, Lucius survived the harsh desert environment through his wits and combat skills. He was discovered by Caesar's Legion scouts while defending a small settlement from raiders. Impressed by Lucius's combat prowess and strategic thinking, Caesar offered him a place within the Legion. Lucius rose through the ranks with distinction, eventually earning the honor of commanding the Praetorian Guard—Caesar's personal bodyguards and elite shock troops. For thirteen years, he has held this position, his authority unchallenged as no Legionnaire has dared to face him in ritual combat.
